dialogues.text: And if you open your mouth again, I'll tell my driver to stick his cock inside it! Understand? Maybe that's what you want! He offers the lights of the restaurant to her as a viciou invitation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to come in?! Maybe we all get to fuck you.... Anna stares back. Nikolai peers at her for a moment befor grabbing Kirill and pulling him away towards the restaura

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is winding up. Chefs and waiters are cleaning surfaces and dishes. The only still point is Semyon, who is cutting and wrapping the birthday cake in small parcel of golden paper. He works intensely and delicately at the back of the kitchen. Nikolai and Kirill enter. Kirill swigs a half-drunk glass of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That girl you fucked in front of me... you remember her? The Ukrainian bitch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So they kick down the door. These are ordinary fucking police. They ask for her by name and they take her away. Some fucking punter must have given them her name. What gives the police the right to take our women, huh? Semyon shoots Kirill a hard look: he's talking too much and too loudly. Kirill ignores the look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Papa, I never seen so many old people in one place. Whose party is it out there? The angel of death?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision    -   9/12/06

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian) She is one hundred years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Semyon works on for a moment then glances at Kirill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirill, go down into the cellar and bring up some brandy. Twelve bottles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirill turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Nikolai, help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He stays here.   I want to talk business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A confused pause.     Kirill looks from Nikolai to his fa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause as Kirill suddenly senses his exclusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Papa, what business? His business is my business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Semyon stares at Kirill and Kirill knows the look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to the cellar Kirill.   And take your time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirill hesitates. He is angry as hell but too scared of his father's gaze to say anything. Finally he turns fast and departs, slamming his open hand against the door as h goes. Semyon waits a moment before returning to the business of cutting the cake. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you deal with the old man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai nods. A pause.     Semyon looks up and fixes Nikolai with a sta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLUE Revision    -   11/4/06                            7

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time you joined us. A long moment. The thing Nikolai has been working for has finally happened. There seems to be little joy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Papa. Semyon returns to his work.    Nikolai hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What shall I tell Kirill? Semyon continues with the cake, unconcerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him I changed my mind about the brandy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cellar is half lit, the arched walls lined with crate of wine. Flour, grease and potatoes are stored here. As Nikolai walks down the steps into the gloom, he hears Kir singing a Russian folk song to himself as he drags a case of brandy across the cellar floor. Kirill has already opened a bottle of brandy and takes a long swig as Nikolai joins him. He grins as he gestures at the brandy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My dad swapped a little Georgian girl for this stuff. Nikolai sits down on a crate, rests his head against the wall. Kirill joins him and swigs some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, don't feel bad. What happened up there is just how he is. He plays people against each other. That's all. I realize more and more what he's like. Here, drink to the Georgian girl... Kirill offers the bottle to Nikolai but he refuses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   11/12/06

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   I drink alone now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai decides to bite the bullet, get this news over with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He offered me stars. I accepted them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long pause. This is what Kirill wanted, but now it feel like a stab in the back. Finally Kirill swallows a huge swig of brandy then turns awkwardly to hug Nikolai. He squeezes him hard for a long time then shoves him away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lying)) You think I didn't know already? He told me before. It was my fucking idea. He said there are a lot of things I have to teach you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai nods.    Kirill gets to his feet....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some stuff will take a long time. I've been protecting you until now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I don't know stuff you don't know? I am vor by birth. The stars are a birthmark for me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, Kirill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirill is about to fly into a rage but Nikolai gets to hi feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the fuck are you going? We've got to celebrate. Help me with these bottles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   11/12/06

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Nikolai heads for the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dad don't need the bottles any more. As Nikolai departs Kirill calls after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! We're still partners, right? Thunder and lightning! Nikolai climbs the steps. Kirill is left to swig his bran and stare into the darkness. He wipes his eyes angrily with his sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. TRANS-SIBERIAN RESTAURANT. TWO DAYS LATER
dialogues.text: Sweet Russian choral music covers the next four scenes. The street outside the restaurant is now flooding with rain. A Daimler and a Bentley are already parked. A large SUV pulls up and a hard-looking Russian man in his sixtie (VALERY) is ushered from the car by bodyguards in suits and shades. He is greeted by a darker-looking man in his fifties (THE GYPSY) who has a fur coat around his shoulders. Semyon is waiting on the doorstep, dressed in a fine dark suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The curtains are drawn against the rainy light. The Gypsy Valery, Semyon and TWO OTHER RUSSIAN MEN are sitting in a line behind a restaurant table, like a judging panel. After a moment Nikolai enters, dressed in suit and tie fo the biggest interview of his life. The vory behind the table greet him. Then Nikolai takes off his jacket and removes his tie. He then takes off his shirt, to reveal that his upper body i decorated with elaborate tattoos (details to follow). He carefully places his shirt over the chair then sits down. The panel of the vory study his body, the Gypsy pushing a candle across the table to better illuminate th detail of the tattoos. Only after the men have studied the tattoos does the interview begin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision       -   9/12/06

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The following dialogue should not be translated, and can be cut around to suggest a long and grueling interview.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can see that you were in prison in Siberia. And that you were a thief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father was a government worker. He fixed the cars of officials. I began by selling the spare parts when I was fifteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no forced tattoos?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were not co-operative?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spent two years in the punishment block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You went through the Crosses in St. Petersburg?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in solitary confinement fifteen times. I was called 'The Stump' because they couldn't shift me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father was a bitch and a weak fucker for working with the Government, that's right isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai flickers a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. My father means nothing to me. My Mother....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no mother.      She was a whore anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   11/12/06                           7

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I have no mother and no father. There is only the code, the vory v zakone code which I have always followed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is why there is an empty place above your heart. Where the stars will go. And why there is an empty place on your knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am dead already. I died when I was fifteen. Now I live in the zone all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have never worked for the government? Any government?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have lived off Albanians and Georgians. I steal from them within the law. The questions and answers are delivered with great solemnity, making the ceremony feel almost religious. Candles burn, the men all sip water. Semyon is silent throughout but listens attentively. Towards the end of the interview there is the ghost of a smile on the Gypsy's face and this pleases Semyon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wizened old Russian man (THE TATTOOIST) arrives at the kitchen door, carrying a battered leather case. The kitch door is opened as he arrives and Semyon greets him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The choral music continues as we see the old man opening his case and pulling out tattooing equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   11/12/06

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Nikolai is sitting in a banquette at the back, wearing only his underpants. We circle Nikolai as the tattooist begins to work on his knees, preparing Nikolai's knee cap for the tattoos. The needle bites at Nikolai's skin as the old tattooist wipes away the blood. Then we see the needle working on the empty spaces above Nikolai's heart, tattooing the star symbol. Nikolai now has a star tattoo on each knee and two eight- pointed stars on his chest. He is now a member of the vor v zakone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna is lying awake, her curtains drawn against the daylight. Helen knocks and enters with a cup of tea, just as in the opening scenes. Anna sits up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost accusing) Have you slept at all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna doesn't answer.    Helen looks anxious as she peeks of the curtains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to get hold of Stepan for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's usually either at home or at his sisters. But she hasn't heard from him at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen is trying to hide her anxiety but Anna sees it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He did spit in that horrible man's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think the driver would do anything to Stepan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   11/12/06

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Helen knows Anna well, senses some flicker of attraction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know what he would do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't spoken to him since, have you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna doesn't answer and Helen's anger sparks... She leave and slams the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are in St. Pancras, North London. More rain. Ozim is waiting nervously, blowing into his hands against the cold. The Turkish bath building is a Victorian red-brick edifice. Nikolai pulls up in his Mercedes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ozim and Nikolai are undressing. The place is deserted apart from an OLD TURKISH BATH-HOUSE ATTENDANT who is distributing towels. Ozim is unbuttoning his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Semyon recommends these places for business meetings because you can see what tattoos a man has.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai is pulling off his shirt and Ozim reacts to the sight of the fresh eight-pointed star tattoos. Ozim chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. We have a lot to get through. Let's cook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ozim disappears into a steam room, naked. Nikolai watches him go, a private agenda bubbling beneath the surface.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: PINK Revision   -   11/12/06

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ozim and Nikolai sit side by side, sweating.    There is one else in the steam room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our lines to Kabul get broken every two or three weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Americans. Fucking NATO. (pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valery Nabokov imports flowers and television sets into this country. The television sets are one in ten. That means one in ten have cargo inside them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do they dock? Ozim grins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will tell you when I return from the bathroom. Ozim chuckles as he leaves in a swirl of steam. Nikolai leans back against the cold wall, his tattoo almost the only visible thing through the steam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ozim is dressing frantically, his face suddenly betraying his real anxiety. He checks his watch as he puts it back on his wrist. After a moment the two Chechen brothers who killed Ekrem enter the changing room. They swagger up to Ozim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   11/12/06                      83-83A

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He gulps down his fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirill is in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ozim slaps his chest to denote the place where they will see the vor tattoo. They head towards the steam room as Ozim grabs his shoes and hurries towards the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai is sweating hard, staring at the ceiling. The steam room door opens but the steam is now so thick he can't see who has entered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ozim?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees a shape... a clothed body. He realizes immediatel Suddenly one of the brothers is upon him and has him in a head lock. He strokes the tattoo on Nikolai's chest as if this were confirmation of who this is. He grunts an instruction and his brother emerges through the steam wit an open razor. Nikolai is naked, alone. Suddenly he kicks the razor guy in the balls and uses a martial arts chop to free himself from the other brother. In the steam there are boots and bare feet and knees and fingers flying. Nikolai manages to gouge the eye of one brother and throw another against the wall. He obviously has serious combat training but the brothers are strong and angry. Suddenly Nikolai is slashed across the arm by the razor and blood oozes into the steam and hot water. All the men are slipping and falling on the blood and hot water. Another slash of the razor cuts his thigh open. All the men are now covered in blood and Nikolai, with a final surge of strength, manages to cripple one brother with a blow to the throat, and the other with an elbow to the temple. As the Chechens slump to the floor, Nikolai fumbles in th bloody water for the razor, finds it, kneels, and slashes their throats. He lurches to his feet, drops the razor, and staggers out of the steam room.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: GOLDENROD Revision     -   11/27/06

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aziz and a group of a dozen doctors and nurses are eating lunch, some in party hats, some drinking red wine out of paper cups. Aziz seems anxious, distracted. Anna enters i a hurry, locates Aziz and joins him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so late. Sorry. She looks around the 'party' with horror...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine, although I think I've had enough. He smiles and downs his glass of wine in one go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul, on my way here I made a decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mock horror)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't possibly dump me. We're not even going out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take my hand. Aziz, confused, takes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel my pulse. Aziz feels Anna's pulse.      Anna takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to apply to adopt Christine. A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLUE Revision    -   11/4/06

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you feel that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aziz smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai is being hurried down the corridor, his face cove with an oxygen mask. He is covered with a surgical gown which is covered in blood. His arm flops out from under the covers as the paramedics rush him into the hospital. Anna is walking in the opposite direction. Then, as Nikolai's trolley passes, Anna sees Nikolai's arm, floppi from under the covers. She sees the eagle tattoo on the back of his hand. Anna freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai is conscious in bed, attached to a single drip. His wounds have been stitched up. A doctor and two nurses are settling Nikolai's vital sign moving around him, checking his temperature. Finally they clear the bed and through the glass of the room we see Anna, standing outside, staring in at Nikolai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai is peering through half-opened eyes. The last nurse is checking his vital signs. Then Anna enters. The nurse stops work...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it OK to talk to him for a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nurse hesitates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's still in trauma.   Do you know him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna glances at Nikolai who is rousing himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision      -   9/12/06

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nurse is reluctant but sees Anna's fierce stare and finally leaves. After she has gone Nikolai stirs, focuses on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you did birth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai smiles, but Anna is trying hard to even out her fear and anger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My uncle....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai tries to sit up and registers pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the one who spat in your face... He's disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause. Nikolai gasps in pain as he raises himself up. Anna sees the wounds on his arms and glimpses the tattoos on his chest, scaring her even more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we don't hear from him soon we're going to the police...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai reaches for a bottle of water and manages to take a swig. Anna is impatient for a reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know where he is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause. Nikolai finishes the bottle of water in one thirsty swig. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in Scotland. In Edinburgh. In a five-star hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna is locating the door in case she has to flee as Niko swings his legs out of the bed to stretch his painful lim

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision    -   9/12/06                           8

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edinburgh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to need some clothes. I arrived here without any. Can you get me some? Anna doesn't budge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't walk out of here naked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't walk out of here because you're attached to a drip. Explain Edinburgh. Nikolai sighs, sits back down on the bed.    He finally s softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your uncle knew too much. Nikolai shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was told to get rid of him. I was meant to send him to heaven with a bullet in his head. Instead I sent him to Edinburgh. With a first-class ticket. A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is of the old school. He understood the situation. Exile or death. Edinburgh was his idea. He said they throw a great party at New Year. And he said it was a good excuse to get away from his family. Nikolai smiles at Anna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... just a pair of jeans and a T- shirt. A jacket. And some shoes. Anna still looks disbelieving.   Nikolai sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GOLDENROD Revision   -   11/27/06

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hotel is called the Caledonian. Without a pause Anna leaves.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Anna is sitting on the bed beside Christine's crib. Christine is asleep. Anna is speaking into her cell phone trying to keep her voice down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...no, I couldn't get much sense out of him, he was drunk. A pause.   Anna looks exasperated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mum, I don't want to tell you how I found him because I don't want another argument. I just wanted you to know he's definitely safe... Anna listens with weariness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we can't tonight. I'm working. I need the money. (a pause)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a place of my own, for Christ's sake! She listens with growing anger until she finally cuts the call without a word. Christine stirs but doesn't wake. She leans back against the wall, already regretful.

dialogues.speaker: NEXT MORNING.
dialogues.text: The ward is busy as Yuri, the police specialist from the Russian desk, enters wearing a heavy overcoat. He looks all around and approaches a nurse. PINK Revision    -   11/12/06                          89

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai's drip is being removed by A NURSE. Nikolai is examining his healing wounds. Then through the glass of the door he notices Yuri, speaking to a nurse, and obviou recognizes him. The nurse points Yuri in Nikolai's direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cold and the wind is blowing. We see rooftops behind them. Yuri is lighting Nikolai's cigarette. Nikolai is wearing Yuri's overcoat loosely over his hospital gown. Yuri lights his own cigarette and they smoke in silence for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got my message? Yuri chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using a dead body to file a progress report must be against FSB regulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called improvisation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been improvising quite a lot lately. And taking risks. He glances at the cuts on Nikolai's hands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe too many. Nikolai suddenly glares at Yuri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't come here to give me flowers... Yuri shakes his head and prepares to deliver bad news. Nikolai turns as if to go back inside. Yuri grabs Nikolai arm and speaks formally....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   11/12/06

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In light of what has happened to you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai shakes his head wearily....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian) Ah, Christ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and in light of other violent incidents associated with you, the Russian desk at Scotland Yard have made an official request to the Russian embassy that your undercover operation in London be terminated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai doesn't react for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian) You have gone beyond what was agreed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With his cigarette dangling from his mouth Nikolai begins to unbutton his overcoat..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In my opinion you should see this as good news. You've been in the zone far too long...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai turns and slowly pulls open the overcoat and the thin hospital gown beneath it. He reveals the eight-pointed star tattoos on his chest an Yuri reacts with absolute astonishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they terminate the operation now, they will be wasting this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause. Yuri looks shocked and slightly horrified. Nikolai too suddenly seems almost ashamed that he has got this far. After a long silence Nikolai mumbles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   11/12/06                           9

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell the Russian desk you saw stars over my heart. OK? Tell them I'm through the door. A pause.   Yuri is still overwhelmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are bound to ask... who did you kill? A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them I only killed myself. A pause. Yuri is humbled. They share a moment of understanding as they smoke. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you can tell them I'm going to replace Semyon at the head of the London organization. Yuri laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What drugs are they giving you? Maybe it's the anesthetic speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to take Semyon out of the picture. I want you to arrest him. Nikolai lights another cigarette from the stub of the one he is smoking. Yuri is incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrest him for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rape. Yuri begins to chuckle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl was fourteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLUE Revision    -   11/4/06

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incredulous)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And of course, she will testify...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't have to.   She's dead. A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she had Semyon's baby. If you prove the baby is his and prove the girl was under age when the baby was conceived, that's statutory rape. A pause.   Yuri begins it think it through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you need is the baby and some of Semyon's DNA. For poetic reasons I suggest you take his blood. Yuri peers at Nikolai with awe.    A long pause.   Finall Yuri smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You intrigue me. A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we had never had this conversation they would have sent you home. You could have spent the Spring in the mountains. Riding your bicycle to your office every morning through fields of flowers. A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why stay? Nikolai reacts but doesn't answer. A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You keep in touch. Yuri studies Nikolai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   11/12/06

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And take care, Mikhail. Yuri tenderly takes his overcoat from Nikolai's shoulders and goes back through the fire-escape door. Nikolai is left cold and exposed in his thin gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai is playing chess against himself, sitting on the bed, trying hard to concentrate. There is a knock and Anna enters, carrying an old shopping bag. She takes out a worn pair of jeans and a T-shirt, a denim jacket and a battered pair of shoes. Nikolai smiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is Uncle Stepan? Instead of answering, Anna lays the clothes on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadpan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're from the morgue. They belonged to someone who died yesterday. Nikolai picks up the jeans and examines them.     They're too big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe I'm doing a favor for someone just because he had the decency not to murder a member of my family. Nikolai smiles but Anna turns to leave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... wait a minute... Nikolai steps behind the bed screen to pull on the jeans. He speaks from behind the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is your bike still working OK? A pause.   Anna considers leaving but hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.     It's OK.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Nikolai steps out from behind the screen, the baggy jeans tightly belted, his chest bare. For the first time Anna sees the extent of Nikolai's body tattoos and reacts.... Nikolai sees her reaction to the tattoos and doesn't care for it. He grabs the T-shirt and pulls it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you get in touch with Tatiana's family in Russia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai is now dressed, his cut and tattooed arms still showing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So the baby's still in England.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.   Anna nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's staying here for good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They peer at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you care?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai shrugs and grabs the shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stepan said you were kind to him. He said you were risking your own life to keep him alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and all the thanks I get is a pair of dead man's shoes. (pause)                                         * I listen to you.                                    *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic)                                     * Do you really?                                      *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. About Semyon and the baby.                     * Thank you.                                          *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still wary)                                      *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You thank me for that?                                * Their eyes lock across a huge divide.   He rubs the tatto on his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating tattoos)                              *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These things are just marks on the skin, you know? Anna nods. An awkward pause, then Anna turns and leaves quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The restaurant is filled with balloons of every color, al over the floor and bouncing off the tables. A large `Happ New Year' banner is hanging from the wall. Kirill is sitting on the floor amongst the balloons, blow up another one. Maria, Semyon's little granddaughter, run in to the restaurant and stops to stare at Kirill. He begins to inflate another balloon then stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you looking at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You. Maria comes to him and take a balloon. She tries to blow it up but fails. Kirill smiles and blows it up for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you and Grandpa shouting about last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounded like something. Kirill takes a deep breath to blow a balloon then stops and looks at Maria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone I know got hurt and I blamed Grandpa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you fight each other?    I heard banging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -    11/12/06

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's not a fight if one of you doesn't fight back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.     Kirill smiles.   We see slight abrasions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, today I do as I am told.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods and Kirill blows another balloon. At that moment Kirill sees on the security monitor behind the bar that a police car is pulling up outside the restaurant. His face clouds as another pulls up beside it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maria.   Go upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Semyon sits at a bare table, opposite Yuri from the Russi desk. A uniformed officer stands nearby, and there is a police doctor with a medical bag sitting at the next tabl waiting. The whole scene is rendered surreal by all the balloons which bounce around them. Semyon is in full charming old man mode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian) You'll have a drink, Yuri...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is half on his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian) I don't drink on duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian) Sometimes I don't believe you are really Russian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian) I've told you, I am half Russian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian) Then have half a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yuri shakes his head.     Semyon goes to the optic and he himself to a vodka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE Revision       -    9/12/06                     97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what is all this nonsense?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just need a blood sample.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can take the sample right now voluntarily or I can get an order from the court. It's up to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Semyon glances at the doctor and chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian) He sits there like a vampire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian) What, you are afraid of needles, Semyon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Semyon's face hardens and he glares at Yuri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am afraid of... conspiracies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.     Yuri speaks softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will return tomorrow with a court order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.       I've done nothing wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Semyon begins to roll up his sleeve, revealing a long scr of tattoos. Then a needle is being pushed into Semyon's arm by the doctor. Semyon's face doesn't flicker. He stares into Yuri's eyes. BLUE Revision   -   11/4/06

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirill is preparing food for the night's festivities. Semyon enters and goes straight to the sink. He pulls off the plaster from his arm where the blood was taken and pours some vodka over the tiny puncture hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did they want with you, papa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To poison me. Semyon pours more vodka on the wound then takes a swig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They took blood from me with a needle. Probably the same needle they use for all the junkies and whores and blacks and queers. He glares at Kirill as he rolls his sleeve down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I probably have the fucking queer disease. Kirill has his back turned, doesn't react.   Semyon sits heavily. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would they want your blood, papa? For the first time Semyon looks vulnerable and confused a he admits....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Kirill is surprised to see his father unsure.   He peers him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone is ahead of me. I don't like people ahead of me. Kirill is now unnerved by Semyon's quiet confusion. He watches as Semyon grabs at the bottle of vodka to drink. He speaks softly as he swigs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLUE Revision       -   11/4/06                         9

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) What the hell did that cocksucker want with my blood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirill is reluctant to speak at first but eventually chan his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's about the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (swigging) What baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some bitch was out there saying you were the father of a baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Semyon turns to Kirill, his face hardening...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Semyon approaches and Kirill gets scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was nothing. Just some bitch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman from the hospital.   The midwife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Semyon stares into Kirill's eyes and Kirill mistakes his frantic thought process for anger. Kirill backs away. Semyon is beginning to catch up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The main entrance of the hospital is busy with visitors and staff. There is a `Happy New Year' banner across the entrance. In amongst the bustle of visitors we spy a youn man with his collar turned up and a bunch of red roses in his hand. We then see that it is Kirill, entering the hospital. GOLDENROD Revision   -   11/27/06                      10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna is walking down a corridor with her crash helmet in her hand, heading for another shift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are close on Kirill's face as he studies a map of the hospital near the elevators. Anna comes down a stairwell and spots Kirill - she especially notices the roses - just as he gets into an elevator. The elevator doors close. Was it really him? Anna is not sure. She frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A door opens and Kirill steps into striped moonlight. Clamping the roses under his arm, he pulls a black zip-up sports bag from under his coat. After a brief dialogue with himself, he produces a half bottle of vodka and take a swig. Then he hurries on.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Anna walks onto the ward in her uniform. She checks a few stats as she walks by various beds. She then glances over at Christine's private room. She tiptoes into the room and goes to the crib. She finds it empty - except for a bunch of red roses. Outside the ward is now filling up with visitors. Babies cry, people laugh. Anna goes back out to the ward and calls to a nurse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sonya! Is someone bathing Christine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   She's in her cot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well she's not. She's not. PINK Revision   -   11/12/06                          101

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna runs at breakneck speed through the corridors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirill is at the wheel of Nikolai's Mercedes. He swigs from his bottle of vodka, which is now more than half emp He fires the engine and reverses. A car passing by has to slam on its brakes. Kirill yells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you stupid fucker!! A horn blows. The passing car accelerates angrily by. The we hear a baby crying. Kirill looks into the half darknes of the back seat and we see Kirill's black sports bag, partially zipped up. Christine is crying inside it, her little grasping hand protruding past the zipper. Kirill speaks softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be quiet baby. Quiet baby.    It's OK. PINK Revision     -   11/12/06                         10

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Anna flies out of Nikolai's room and spots a nurse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to the patient with the knife cuts? The Russian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just discharged him.   A couple of minutes ago. Anna runs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna runs fast down the corridor towards the hospital exi She spots Nikolai ahead of her. She pushes past a couple of drunks and flies at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where have they taken Christine?! Nikolai reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bastards!! Where will he take her?! Tell me!! People back away as Nikolai grabs Anna's arms and holds her still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?! Anna studies Nikolai's face and sees his genuine confusio She calms down a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirill. Kirill has taken Christine. I saw him here! I thought he was coming to see you, but he wasn't, was he? Nikolai curses under his breath and thinks fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You brought your bike? BLUE Revision   -   11/4/06                            10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same dockside where Nikolai dumped Soyka and recommen this as the best place to dispose of a body. Kirill pulls up slowly in Nikolai's Mercedes. The car is parked for a long time before finally the headlights are switched off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai and Anna race to Anna's motorbike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll drive. Anna and Nikolai leap aboard the bike and it starts first time. With Nikolai riding pillion, they roar away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna and Nikolai ride through London streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the edge of the dockside, Kirill is kneeling with the zip-up bag before him. Suddenly fireworks begin to burst over the Thames. It is the stroke of midnight. Kirill unzips the bag. When he looks inside Christine stops crying. He peers at her, wiping away tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a little girl, Papa, a little sweet fucking girl... Kirill sobs then Christine cries...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shush, shush... Kirill lifts her out of the bag and holds her close to him, fireworks still illuminating the London skyline. He looks down at the freezing cold water, utterly confused. He whispers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, my little sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLUE Revision   -   11/4/06                           103

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: For a moment we believe he is going to throw her into the water. Instead he begins to sing a lullaby to her and her crying stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PINK Revision    -   11/12/06

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Then we see a single light behind him. In a firework flas we see Nikolai and Anna climbing off the bike. They approach cautiously. Kirill stares at the man he loves. A pause. Christine begins to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirill, let me take the baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stay where you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's cold, Kirill. Kirill suddenly screams as another barrage of fireworks explodes. Nikolai doesn't move. Kirill is dangerously close to the edge of the dock. Maybe he'll throw himself in too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirill, a vor doesn't kill little babies. Kirill is motionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like this would be bad for all of us. Your dad has gone too far, Kirill. A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Russian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's our turn now. Nikolai steps forward slowly.    As he gets closer Kirill hugs the baby. Finally Nikolai reaches Kirill and hugs him. As he does he edges him away from the dockside. The three of them ar locked in a long embrace. Nikolai emerges from the embrace with Christine in his arms. He quickly hands her to Anna who hugs her close. Kirill turns to Nikolai.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear I didn't know my dad was setting you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YELLOW Revision    -   11/21/06

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going away. When he's gone the family business will be yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can be partners again. Thunder and lightning, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirill smiles through his tears and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get into the car. I'll drive you home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pause. Kirill dries his eyes and heads for the car. Nikolai looks at Anna, who is hugging the baby. He waits a long time before realizing he must leave her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're OK, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anna nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you really? Why have you helped us?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Nikolai can't answer truthfully, though he longs to do so There is a long pause before he manages to finds a suitab lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I become King if the King is still in place? A pause.   He laughs. Anna studies him, unsure. More New Year fireworks explode over the river. Kirill yells from the car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come on, Nikolai! We're missing the fucking party of the year out there!! Get here and drive!! (in Russian)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a fucking order!! Nikolai and Anna peer at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I can drive you somewhere? She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's someone I can call.   He'll come and fetch us. Nikolai nods, not liking the information but hiding it. Nikolai comes close and gently uncovers Christine's face. He smiles. Kirill is hooting the car horn. After a moment Nikolai and Anna kiss each other gently before Nikolai heads for the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A summer's day. Anna, Helen and Uncle Stepan are preparin to eat Sunday lunch. Stepan is carving. The conversation is jovial as Anna and Helen bring dishes of food to the table. Then we hear a baby crying. Anna goes to a small crib and lifts a six-month-old Christine out. She hands her to Helen who hugs her. Over this happy scene we hear Tatiana in V.O., a repeat of the first words we heard her say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Tatiana. My father died in the mines in my village, so he was already buried when he died... Anna takes Christine back and takes her to the window to peer outside, staring across the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nikolai is sitting at a window table, alone, sipping vodk staring back across the park. He peers out at ordinary life going on in the streets outside. Tatiana's V.O. continues...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were all buried there. Beneath the soil of Russia. That is why I left to find a better life. Nikolai finishes his drink.
